page.title: 01BERROW TO BREAN,SOMERSET
page.content: THE SOMERSET COASTLINE HERE RUNS NORTH TO SOUTH WITH THE BRISTOL CHANNEL TO THE WEST AND THE SOMERSET LEVELS AND MENDIP SLOPES TO THE EAST. THE COASTLINE IS FORMED OF SAND DUNES WHICH HAVE BEEN THREATENED BY EROSION BUT WHICH ARE NOW BECOMING RE-ESTABLISHED.TO THE WEST OF THE COASTLINE,SANDS SLOPE SLOWLY RESULTING IN A WIDE INTER TIDAL REGION MOSTLY SANDY. THE INLAND IS FLAT AND CUT BY SERIES OF DRAINAGE DITCHES IT IS POOR FARMING LAND.THE COAST ROAD IS THE ARTERY FOR CARAVANS AND CHALET HOLIDAY SITES WHICH ARE BOTH SIDES OF THE ROAD. PERMANENT POPULATION IS APPROX 200. IN THE HIGHT OF THE SUMMER THIS INCREASES TO 7000.THERE IS ONE NATIONAL HOLIDAY SITE,THE FIRST TO BE BUILT BY FRED PONTIN.
